New Records: Jake Bauers hit a game-ending RBI single to secure the Brewers' 2-1 win.
The Brewers clinched the NL Central division title, making the playoffs for the sixth time in seven seasons.
Key Match Events: Jake Bauers' ninth-inning RBI single was the game-ending moment.
The game was marked by low scoring and intense competition.
Pre-Game Insights: The Brewers had already clinched the NL Central before the game, adding pressure to win.
Freddy Peralta allowed one run in five innings, while Aaron Nola pitched seven innings for the Phillies.
Post-Match Reflections: Jake Bauers expressed relief and pride in the team's victory.
Devin Williams recorded a key ninth-inning strikeout.
The Phillies were close to securing the playoffs but fell short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured a combined 28 strikeouts.
The Phillies were one win away from the playoffs, while the Brewers secured their division title.
